Title: A gamma function inequality
Content: I would like to prove $$\frac{\Gamma(n+\frac{1}{2})}{\Gamma(n+1)} \le \frac{1}{\sqrt{n}}$$ for all natural $n \ge 1$. The inequality does seem to be true numerically, but the proof eludes me.
AcceptedAnswer: This follows directly from Gautschi's inequality , valid for $0 < s < 1$ and $x > 0$: $$x^{1-s} < \frac{\Gamma(x+1)}{\Gamma(x+s)} < (x+1)^{1-s}.$$ As a side note, the link is to NIST's new (as of this year) Digital Library of Mathematical Functions .  The DLMF is an update of the classic Abramowitz and Stegun text, Handbook of Mathematical Functions .
